chapters.title: The First Body: Arriving at the Scene
chapters.summary: Introduces the forensic metaphor and prepares the reader to approach their relationship history as an investigator, not a victim. Establishes the mindset of curious detachment and evidence collection.
key_events: Introducing the 'Relationship Autopsy' concept.
Shifting from emotional blame to forensic observation.
Setting up your 'case file' (journal/notebook).
Choosing your first 'case'—a significant past relationship to examine.
chapters.ending_hook: You are no longer just a participant in your past; you are now the lead detective. The scene is sealed. Your first case file is open. What is the initial evidence that catches your eye?

chapters.title: The Timeline of Events: Establishing Chronology
chapters.summary: Guides the reader in mapping the objective timeline of a relationship—from first meeting to final communication—separating facts from feelings to see the skeleton of the bond.
key_events: Creating a neutral, fact-based timeline of key relationship milestones.
Noting the 'first response' (initial attraction/connection).
Identifying the 'point of contamination' (when problems first emerged).
Marking the official 'time of death' (the end).
chapters.ending_hook: With the timeline laid bare, a shape begins to emerge. But when you compare the facts to your memory, where do the gaps appear? The timeline is solid, but the motive is still unknown.

chapters.title: Gathering the Evidence: Messages, Memories, and Artifacts
chapters.summary: Teaches how to collect and review tangible and intangible evidence—old texts, photos, shared mementos, and core memories—without being overwhelmed by emotion.
key_events: The 'artifact box' exercise: reviewing physical/digital remnants.
Distinguishing between reliable and unreliable 'witness' (memory).
Identifying recurring phrases or arguments (verbal evidence).
Noting the evidence that is conspicuously *missing* (what was never said).
chapters.ending_hook: The evidence is bagged and tagged. One piece doesn't fit the story you've always told yourself. What is it, and why does it feel so dangerous to acknowledge?

chapters.title: The Wound Library: Performing an Autopsy on Your Past
chapters.summary: Connects current relationship patterns to earlier formative bonds (family, childhood friendships, first loves). Introduces the concept of 'original wounds' that get re-activated.
key_events: Tracing a current pattern back to its likely 'origin case'.
Identifying your core attachment injuries (abandonment, betrayal, neglect, etc.).
The 'blueprint' exercise: How early bonds set expectations.
Recognizing wound-driven vs. values-driven choices.
chapters.ending_hook: The pattern is no longer a mystery; it's a repetition. You've found the original wound, but now you must ask: How have you, unknowingly, been inviting people to reopen it?

chapters.title: Cause of Death: Diagnosing the Fatal Flaws
chapters.summary: Analyzes the specific mechanisms that led to the relationship's end. Moves beyond superficial reasons ('we grew apart') to identify the core dysfunctional dynamic.
key_events: Categorizing the 'cause of death': Was it a slow bleed (erosion), a sudden trauma (betrayal), or organ failure (incompatibility)?
The role grid: Identifying which roles you and the other person played (Rescuer, Critic, Withholder, etc.).
Pinpointing the breakdown of repair attempts.
Separating your contribution from theirs in the dynamic.
chapters.ending_hook: The cause of death is signed off on the report. But an investigator's job isn't to assign guilt—it's to understand *how it happened*. The 'how' reveals a startling truth about your own protective strategies.

chapters.title: The Ghost in the Machine: Unconscious Scripts and Invisible Contracts
chapters.summary: Exposes the hidden, unspoken agreements and life scripts we bring into relationships, often formed in childhood, that dictate our behavior and expectations.
key_events: Unearthing your relationship 'script' (e.g., 'I must earn love,' 'Conflict is dangerous').
Identifying the 'invisible contract' you wrote and assumed the other person signed.
The 'reenactment' cycle: How we unconsciously seek to fix the past with new people.
Discovering your core relational belief: 'My worth is conditional on...'
chapters.ending_hook: The script is now in your hands. You can read the lines you've been reciting for years. The power in this moment is simple yet profound: a script can be rewritten.

chapters.title: Witness Testimony: Interpreting Your Inner Voices
chapters.summary: Guides the reader in auditing their internal dialogue—the inner critic, protector, child, and sage—to understand how these 'witnesses' influence relationship choices.
key_events: Meeting your internal 'board of directors' (different inner voices).
Identifying which voice dominated during key relationship moments.
Understanding the protective (but misguided) intent of each voice.
Cultivating the 'Sage' voice—the integrated, compassionate observer.
chapters.ending_hook: The courtroom of your mind is in session. You finally understand who has been driving the bus. Now, the gavel is in your hand. Who will you choose to preside over your next relationship?

chapters.title: Comparative Analysis: Identifying Your Pattern Across Multiple Cases
chapters.summary: Steps back to conduct a meta-analysis of 3-4 past relationships. The reader identifies the recurring themes, casting choices, and outcomes that define their unique pattern.
key_events: The 'relationship lineup': Side-by-side comparison of key cases.
Spotting your 'type'—not in looks, but in dysfunctional dynamics.
Charting your emotional exits: Do you leave, get left, or blow things up?
Identifying the common 'victim' or 'villain' story you tell.
chapters.ending_hook: The pattern is no longer deniable. It's there, in black and white, across every case file. This isn't about bad luck; it's about a blueprint. The question shifts from 'Why does this keep happening?' to 'What is this pattern *getting* me?'

chapters.title: Closing the Case: The Art of Forensic Forgiveness
chapters.summary: Moves from analysis to integration. Teaches a process of releasing blame—for self and others—through understanding, not exoneration, to free energy for the present.
key_events: Differentiating forgiveness from approval or reconciliation.
The 'evidence-based narrative': Writing a neutral story of the relationship.
Conducting a 'chain of causality' to see all players as flawed humans.
Ritualizing release: Symbolically closing the case file.
chapters.ending_hook: The case is closed, not forgotten. The evidence is archived, not burning in your hands. With the weight of the past cataloged, you feel a new space open up inside you. What wants to grow there?

chapters.title: Rewriting the Protocol: Drafting New Relationship Standards
chapters.summary: Using the forensic insights, the reader proactively defines their new 'operating procedures' for relationships—their non-negotiables, values, and early warning systems.
key_events: Creating your 'Relationship Bill of Rights'.
Defining your 'Green, Yellow, and Red Flag' list based on past evidence.
Establishing your 'protocol' for conflict, repair, and communication.
Articulating your core needs (not wants) for connection.
chapters.ending_hook: The new protocol is clear. It's not a wish list, but a operational manual built from the hard data of your past. For the first time, you have a filter that values your peace over chemistry. What happens when you start to use it?

chapters.title: Live Investigation: Applying Forensic Tools to Current Connections
chapters.summary: Teaches how to use the detective mindset in real-time within current friendships, family ties, or new romantic interests, preventing old patterns from playing out.
key_events: Practicing 'real-time evidence assessment' in conversations.
The 'pause for autopsy' technique when triggered.
Asking forensic questions instead of reacting emotionally.
Testing new behaviors and observing the evidence of results.
chapters.ending_hook: You're no longer just living your relationships; you're consciously co-authoring them. A potential red flag appears, but instead of panic, you feel a calm curiosity. You reach not for your heart, but for your mental case file. What does the evidence suggest?

chapters.title: The New Case File: Building a Case for Secure Love
chapters.summary: The final chapter focuses on the future. Guides the reader in intentionally collecting evidence of health, safety, and mutual growth in their connections, building a new portfolio of proof for secure attachment.
key_events: Defining what 'evidence of health' looks like for you.
Starting a new, active case file for your current or future primary relationship.
Celebrating and documenting 'small wins' and repairs.
Embracing the role of the lifelong learner of love, not a finished expert.
chapters.ending_hook: The autopsy table is clear. In its place is a drafting table. You have the tools, the data, and the self-awareness. The past has been solved. The future is a case you get to build, piece by intentional piece, starting now. What will the first entry in your new file be?
